timeline.message: Fix package issues after rebase on master
Migrate to support library v28

Run automated AndroidX migration

- Using Android Studio's migration option
- Also ran the following bash script
https://gist.github.com/dlew/5db1b780896bbc6f542e7c00a11db6a0
- Plus some handpicked package changes

Also removed an extra file after the rebase.

Stop ignoring gradle.properties to enable Jetifier for Travis

Also increase Gradle build's heap to avoid OOM during build

Add androidX variant of Roboguice lib

Comment out gradle implementation in favor of jar library.

Update Gradle wrapper & Groovy version

An error that has been fixed as part of this commit.
Error: << was deprecated in Gradle 4.x and removed in Gradle 5.0
Fix: << has been replaced with doLast.

More info here:
https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/upgrading_version_4.html#changes_5.0

Pointing to Gradle 5 support PR for gradle plugin and modifying
settings.gradle to checkout specific commit.
Separate out version constants

Add shadows (Robolectric) for support-v4 package

Issue: "org.robolectric:shadows-supportv4:{latest_version}" library
This library from Robolectric doesn't support AndroidX and internally
uses support-v4 package.

Reference Issue: https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/issues/3985

Temporary Resolution:
As a workaround I've switched to using a clone of this library which
supports AndroidX. Inspiration taken from here:
https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/issues/3985#issuecomment-441390867

Actual Resolution:
If this passes our tests, a future task should be created to start using
FragmentScenario from package -> androidx.fragment:fragment-testing

Official Doc: https://developer.android.com/training/basics/fragments/testing

Update test related libraries

Updated test related libraries and a test that was failing in
WebViewActivityTest class due to usage of AssertJ library's assertThat
function (which doesn't support AndroidX views).

Reason:
AssertJ has been deprecated and doesn't support AndroidX classes.
Ref: https://github.com/square/assertj-android
Instead of AssertJ we should move towards Truth library that they
recommend instead.
Ref: https://truth.dev/comparison.html
Separate out version constants

Update mockito library and its dexmaker

Mockito: https://site.mockito.org/
Dexmaker: https://github.com/linkedin/dexmaker

Fix screenshot test cases

- Updated Screenshot testing library
- Fixed screenshot tests running on wrong thread
Instead of ActivityRule we should be using ActivityScenario which is a
newer API that allows running a test on main thread.
But for now Activity's runOnUiThread function has been used to make
tests pass through minimal change.

- Also Updated screenshots
After running record statement screenshots' directory gets updated and
previous screenshots + directory need to be deleted.

Also updated the naming convention of screenshot generation of test in
LaunchScreenshotTests class.
Separate out version constants
Separate out version constants
Fix code issues after the migration

Fix Glide related issues

Fixed Glide's custom Transformation class after lib upgrade
Note: Inspiration for code in updateDiskCacheKey function has been taken
from various classes that extend BitmapTransformation e.g. CenterCrop &
CenterInside inside Glide's `com.bumptech.glide.load.resource.bitmap`
package.

Update okhttp3 and make Glide use our okhttp3 integration

We can't upgrade to okhttp3 v4.x since it requires the minSdkVersion set
to Lollipop which isn't possible for us, so we are using the v3.12.x
to cater KitKat devices.
(p.s. okhttp3 v3.12.x will be maintained till December 31, 2020.)

Ref: https://square.github.io/okhttp/#requirements
For more info:
https://medium.com/square-corner-blog/okhttp-3-13-requires-android-5-818bb78d07ce

TLS socket factory class has been updated to use X509TrustManager

Also, set message to being non-null in response builder

Separate out signing related configurations to a separate module

Release configurations have been moved out of gradle.properties & app's
build.gradle file to a separate folder named `signing` which will now
contain the .keystore file, keystore.properties file & signing.gradle
script (which will only be executed if the build's type is release).

For more info:
https://developer.android.com/studio/publish/app-signing#secure-shared-keystore
https://stackoverflow.com/a/50966504/1402616

README has also been updated for building a release.
Bonus: Auto-links inside the README have been wrapped inside <> for
better performance during live preview inside Android Studio.
